properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 10 at 10:44AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
For the Fox River...including Dayton...

The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well
as forecast precipitation 24-48 hours into the future. This forecast
is heavily dependent upon the exact location of precipitation that
occurs later today into Saturday, as well as the how much falls
as rain instead of ice/snow.

The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a
* Hydrologic Outlook for possible elevated water levels along the
Fox River at Dayton, or from Millington downstream to confluence
with the Illinois River.
* At 10 AM Friday, the stage was 8.0 feet.
Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor flooding possible.
Water levels may rise to near 12.2 feet at Sunday evening.

This outlook means that elevated river conditions and potential
impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Those with interests along
area rivers should closely monitor future river forecasts and watch
for later statements.

NWSheadline: Elevated water levels possible along the following rivers... Fox River
